isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - TESTING

step1.para: Connect pressure gauge and flow meter into the steering circuit as illustrated ( Figure 132).

figure.caption: Figure 132. Connect Pressure Gauge and Flow Meter into Steering Circuit

step1.para: Close valve on gauge assembly and read supply pump relief pressure.

warning.para: A malfunctioning pressure relief valve may not relieve pump pressure and closing the shutoff valve may cause severe pump damages or high pressure hoses to rupture. Constantly observe the pressure gauge while closing the shutoff valve. If pressure rises rapidly or appears to be uncontrolled, do not completely close the valve before inspecting the pump and pressure relief valve.

step1.para: If supply pump does not meet specifications, repair pump.

If the supply pump is okay, place a 1/2-inch spacer between the axle stops on one side and turn the steering wheel hard in the direction necessary to pinch the spacer block. Record the maximum pressure reading ( Figure 133).
Remove the spacer and repeat test in the opposite direction. Record pressure.
If pressure is equal on both sides, but not within specifications, remove and repair or replace the integral pressure relief valve.
